userQuestion: Tell us about your HLD, LLD Working experience in projects
modelAnswer: I have hands-on experience in designing High-Level Design (HLD) and Low-Level Design (LLD) for multiple projects. In my E-commerce integration project, I worked on designing scalable APIs and backend systems to handle large transaction volumes. In my EOD (End of Day) project, I helped migrate a monolithic application to a distributed microservices-based system, improving performance and reliability. I have also pursued a specialization course from Scaler Academy focused on DSA, HLD, and LLD, which strengthened my design and problem-solving skills.

userQuestion: Do you require sponsorship to work in India?
modelAnswer: No, I am authorized to work in India.

userQuestion: Will you be interested to work abroad? like US or canada
modelAnswer: Yes, I am definitely interested in opportunities to work abroad, including in the US or Canada. While I am authorized to work in India, I would require sponsorship for employment visa status in any other country.

userQuestion: Tell me about the best project you have worked on
modelAnswer:
One of the best projects I worked on was the EOD (End of Day) processing system for a FinTech platform. Initially, the system was a large monolithic application that faced performance issues while processing huge loan transactions daily. I was involved in redesigning it into a scalable, distributed microservices-based architecture using Java, Spring Boot, Kafka, and MongoDB. This helped in significantly improving the system's reliability and processing speed.

My main role was to work on the system's High-Level and Low-Level Design (HLD, LLD), build REST APIs, handle database optimizations, and set up event-driven communication between services. I also worked on Dockerizing the services and deploying them to cloud infrastructure. Overall, this project gave me strong experience in system design, scalability, and working with distributed systems.

userQuestion: Tell me the project you have developed using Python
modelAnswer:
I've developed a few AI-focused projects using Python:
AI-Powered Document Filtering: Led the development of a document filtering solution where users can retrieve documents using natural language queries (voice or text). I used Python with 
Mistral NeMo 12B and LangChain to generate filter JSONs based on these queries.
LangChain AI Agents for EDI: Designed AI agents using LangChain that understand EDI business terms and convert natural language queries into MongoDB queries for aggregated document metadata insights.
AI Instagram Memer: I built a web-based meme generator using OpenAI APIs, allowing automated meme creation and posting to Instagram via APIs.
CodeExpert Tool: Created an AI-powered VS Code extension offering code assistance using Code Llama LLM and AWS SageMaker.
